titleStmt.title: Mercurius Calidonius presenting in a continued diurnall (vvhat is rare, especially from a state of such serious reservancy, and cautious secresie.) A true and perfect relation of all such speeches, disputes, debates, occurrents, and remarkable passages, as have either been delivered, argued, discussed, or occasionally occurred, since this present sessions at Edenburgh.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

Mercurius Calidonius -- The copie of a letter, written by a late commander under his Excellence -- The northerne intelligencer, sent up poste by packet -- The cavaliers catch upon their march -- The oracle of Hammon.
